alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 1:27PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Sagavanirktok River near Dalton Highway from Mileposts 401 to 407. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flood waters are eroding the Dalton Highway between Milepost 401 and 407, with the road down to one lane. If conditions worsen, the road may wash out and become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM AKDT Tuesday,the Sagavanirktok River continues to flow overbank due to remnant ice in the main channel. This is forcing the water to flow west and cause erosion along the Dalton Highway from Milepost 401 to 407. These conditions are expected to persist until ice in the main channel clears. - Rain falling in the headwaters of the Sagavanirktok River is expected through early Wednesday. This will result in rising water levels on the Sagavanirktok River through Thursday. The river is expected to crest near Pump Station 3 early Wednesday morning and at the coast on Thursday. - http://wweather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Travelers are urged to call 511 or visit 511.alaska.gov for the latest on road conditions in the area.
